edu.rit.util

Class Heartbeat

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.Heartbeat

  • public abstract class Heartbeat
extends Object
    Class Heartbeat is the abstract base class for an object that sends heartbeats to and receives heartbeats from some entity.

    When a heartbeat object is constructed, the heartbeat interval is specified. The default heartbeat interval is 30 seconds. The heartbeat object will send heartbeats to the other entity periodically at the heartbeat interval. If the heartbeat object fails to receive a heartbeat from the other entity within 1.5 times the heartbeat interval since receiving the last heartbeat, the heartbeat object decides that the other entity died.

    After constructing a heartbeat object, the heartbeats do not actually start until the enable() method is called.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Heartbeat()
      Construct a new heartbeat object with the default heartbeat interval (30 seconds).
      Heartbeat(long interval, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Construct a new heartbeat object with the given heartbeat interval.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancel()
      Stop exchanging heartbeats with the other entity.
      protected abstract void died()
      Take action when this heartbeat object detects loss of heartbeats from the other entity.
      void enable(ScheduledExecutorService executor)
      Enable this heartbeat object to start exchanging heartbeats.
      void receiveHeartbeat()
      Report that a heartbeat was received from the other entity.
      protected abstract void sendHeartbeat()
      Send a heartbeat to the other entity.

    • Method Detail

      • enable

        public void enable(ScheduledExecutorService executor)
        Enable this heartbeat object to start exchanging heartbeats.
        Parameters:
        executor - Executor for doing timed actions. If null, this heartbeat object is not enabled.

      • receiveHeartbeat

        public void receiveHeartbeat()
        Report that a heartbeat was received from the other entity.

        public void cancel()
        Stop exchanging heartbeats with the other entity.

      • sendHeartbeat

        protected abstract void sendHeartbeat()
                               throws IOException
        Send a heartbeat to the other entity. This method must be overridden in a subclass. Any exception thrown by this method is ignored.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.

      • died

        protected abstract void died()
        Take action when this heartbeat object detects loss of heartbeats from the other entity. This method must be overridden in a subclass.
